Adrian Paul is a British actor of British origin, born May 29, 1959 in London. His worldwide fame is mainly due to his iconic role as Duncan MacLeod in the hit television series “Highlander” which aired from 1992 to 1998. The success of the series, which chronicles the adventures of a Scottish immortal, propelled Adrian Paul onto the front of the stage and earned him great international fame. His charisma, athletic physique and acting talent captivated audiences, making him an icon in the world of entertainment.

After “Highlander”, Adrian Paul continued to pursue his passion for acting by starring in various television and film projects. He is also known for his philanthropic commitment, notably with the “Peace Fund” organization which he founded to help children victims of violence and conflict around the world. His long and diverse career as well as his social commitment make Adrian Paul a respected and admired personality.
